text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Nintendo DS (Dual Screen) released in late 2004, was Nintendo's new portable console designed to compete with Sony's PSP (PlayStation Portable). Equipped with a 66 Mhz processor (133 Mhz on the DSi), 4 MB of RAM (16 on the DSi), 128 sprites max or 120,000 polygons per second, two backlit screens of 256 × 192 pixels (the bottom being a touch screen), a stylus, microphone and WiFi to play online via internet or LAN with 16 other consoles. It’s the second best-selling console of all time (behind the PlayStation 2). Nintendo followed it with the DS Lite in 2006 and the DSi XL in 2009.
